Name: Iberians
History: The Iberians were a people of mysterious origins and language, with a strong tradition of horsemanship and metalworking. A relatively peaceful culture, they usually fought in other's battles only as mercenaries. However, they proved tenacious when Rome sought to take their land and freedom from them, and employed pioneering guerrilla tactics and flaming javelins as they fought back.

Technologies.Name: Toledo Steel
Technologies.History: The Iberians were known to produce the finest iron and steel implements and weapons of the age. The famous 'Toledo Steel.'

Technologies.Name: Soliferrum
Technologies.History: The Iberians used heavy iron javelins.

Technologies.Name: Guerilla (Reform)
Technologies.History: The Iberians employed successful skirmish and ambush tactics in their wars and rebellions against the Romans. They even reached as far as raiding Roman possessions in Africa.

Heroes.Name: Iberian Noble
Heroes.History: Elite Cavalry Skirmisher effective against structures.

CivBonuses.Name: Fortifications
CivBonuses.History: With exception to alluvial plains and river valleys, stone is abundant in the Iberian Peninsula and was greatly used in construction of structures.
CivBonuses.Description: Civil Centres, Fortresses and Defense Towers +25% attack and hit points but +25% stone cost.

CivBonuses.Name: Stone Mining
CivBonuses.History: With exception to alluvial plains and river valleys, stone is abundant in the Iberian Peninsula and was greatly used in construction of structures.

CivBonuses.Name: Flaming Javelins
CivBonuses.History: Iberian tribesmen were noted for wrapping bundles of grass about the shafts of their throwing spears, soaking that in some sort of flammable pitch, then setting it afire just before throwing.
CivBonuses.Description: Elite rank Skirmishers and Iberian Nobles deal additional crush damage.

CivBonuses.Name: Low Armor Use
CivBonuses.History: Most Iberian Soldiers went to war without body armor.
CivBonuses.Description: Citizen Melee infantry -10% wood/metal cost but -15% hit points.

TeamBonuses.Name: Land Of Great Riches
TeamBonuses.History: Iberia was full of natural resources including mines and timber suitable for shipbuilding. This resulted to extensive colonization by Phoenicians and Greeks.

Structures.Name: Revered Monument
Structures.History: Increases the attack damage of nearby friendly units.
Structures.Description: Units in range +10% attack. Replaces the Academy. Build Limit: 5
